mdRecord.dcterms:title: Jardin des Tuileries, general view
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Le Nôtre, André (French garden designer and collector, 1613-1700) [work]
Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: To the east from the Place de la Concorde

Public garden in the heart of Paris. The park was commissioned by Catherine de Medici and designed by Le Notre as the garden of the Tuileries Palace. After being opened to the public for the first time in 1667, it officially became a public park after the French Revolution (1789). [work]
